item.title: Opinion: Alternate endings for modern attention spans
item.description: Some film professors are bemoaning the shortcuts students take to avoid watching assigned movies: some don't know what happens at the end. NPR's Scott Simon offers his own synopses.

item.title: They're cured of leprosy. Why do they still live in leprosy colonies?
item.description: Leprosy is one of the least contagious diseases around — and perhaps one of the most misunderstood. The colonies are relics of a not-too-distant past when those diagnosed with leprosy were exiled.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn is set to ski the Olympic downhill race with a torn ACL. How?
item.description: An ACL tear would keep almost any other athlete from competing -- but not Lindsey Vonn, the 41-year-old superstar skier who is determined to cap off an incredible comeback from retirement with one last shot at an Olympic medal.

item.title: The CIA World Factbook is dead. Here's how I came to love it
item.description: The Factbook survived the Cold War and became a hit online. It mixed quirky cultural notes and trivia with maps, data, and photos taken by CIA officers. But it was discontinued this week.

item.title: California's largest children's hospital system ends gender-affirming care for youth
item.description: Two hospitals in California are discontinuing hormone treatments for transgender youth, citing Trump administration pressures. In the past year, many hospitals and clinics have scaled back that care.
